Description: Five small bundles of textile material in natural colours featuring differentiated morphological structures. Two fragments (fragments 1 and 2) of plain-woven dark brown hair stitched to the remains of a dark brown and camel hair plain-woven structure. Fragment 3: One long twisted scrap of plain-woven light ecru colour cotton (1 ply S, dia. 0.5mm). Fragment 4: One bundle of dark brown wool spun yarn mixed with plant fibres and white fluff. Fragment 5: One camel (i.e. light brown) coloured hair fluff mixed with plant fibres, seeds, wool, and cotton yarns.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kulubnarti, 21-S-2, H1, from fill between arches of 1-19 and 1-20
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
